body: Thank you @kaxil and @fenglu-g for the feedback. I will work on this when I'm back in the office next week.
Lgtm :)
thanks. lgtm
Plus @jgao54  as well
@kaxil - Would this now be OK to cherry-pick into 1.10.2?

```
$ cd $AIRFLOW_HOME
$ virtualenv env
$ source env/bin/activate
$ pip install -e .[devel]
$ pip install tox
$ tox -e py35-backend_mysql -- tests/contrib/hooks/test_bigquery_hook.py
```
got this error even after `pip install cython`
```Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    /Users/01087872/Documents/incubator-airflow/.tox/py35-backend_mysql/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py:42: DistDeprecationWarning: Do not call this function
      warnings.warn("Do not call this function", DistDeprecationWarning)
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File "/private/var/folders/w1/9cq510fj2719932_y9wpyhynh55kwm/T/pip-wheel-jatqikpp/pymssql/setup.py", line 88, in <module>
        from Cython.Distutils import build_ext as _build_ext
    ImportError: No module named 'Cython'
```

sorry I am running a test locally so this works.

```
$ ./run_unit_tests.sh tests.contrib.hooks.test_bigquery_hook:TestBigQueryBaseCursor.test_cancel_queries -s --logging-level=DEBUG
```

I am merging this one. There are still places that needs changing which I am doing it in a separate PR.
Do not Merge this until the CI image is moved to new location

@feng-tao This is a big change, not sure if we should include in 1.10.2. Also, it would have transitive dependencies and resolving can be a nightmare. However, I don't have a strong reservation against it, so give it a try on cherry-pick this on v1.10-test branch (may be on your fork).
Done

I just tried to reproduce @r39132 error but I can't.
I ran `pip install .` from the current `master` branch and installed the following versions successfully in a python 3.6.5 venv.

Airflow Version: v2.0.0.dev0+
Tenacity Version: 4.12.0

After installation I ran `airflow initdb` then `airflow scheduler` then `airflow webserver` and all seems to work - no errors.

Can someone else reproduce the error? I would like to fix it if it has not already been fixed.

Emmanual Bard brought up a good point about the scheduler health check. What you have only checks the last scheduled run, not the scheduler heartbeat which is what we really want to know. The query should look something like this:

```
select max(latest_heartbeat) from job
where job_type = 'SchedulerJob'
and state = 'running'
```

```
Note: The -binary package is meant for beginners to start playing with Python and PostgreSQL without the need to meet the build requirements. 

If you are the maintainer of a publish package depending on psycopg2 you shouldn’t use psycopg2-binary as a module dependency. For production use you are advised to use the source distribution.
```
